Drafted July 12, 1959
Bramley Cottage
Links Hoad
Bromley, Surrey, England
Transcribed July 16, 1959
Department of Badio and
Television Broadcasting
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis 14, Minnesota
To1 Harry J, Skornia
cc * Bob Coleman
Bill Harley ^
Keith Engar
From* Burton Paulu
Heturned from 18-day drive on the Continent a couple of
nights ago to find your letter of June 22 waiting for me.
Glad to read of fund possibility for NASB to stay in EBU.
As to Bayreuth and Salzburg. The revised Salzburg
program makes it look like a very valuable meeting. Since
you say, "If Engar and Harley agree, I agree to your attendance
at Salzburg August 23-29, and Bayreuth enroute"; and since
Keith has implied approval; while bill hasnâ€™t expressed himself
at all; I shall plan to take this trip, unless disapproval
reaches me first.
I have written again to the head of Baverlan Hadio-
Televislon. He never answered my letter of March 5 (copies to
you), so I sent him another copy today, and asked him to
arrange for me to see an opera at Bayreuth on August 20, to
talk to some of his people there on August 21, and suggested
a meeting in Munich around noon on August 22 (Munich is on
the circuitous route I must follow to get from Bayreuth to
Salzburg.)
Total costs for this trip should be well within the $475.61
remaining from my $1,000 advance, but might exceed one or the
other separate balance. (By my records* $221.06 on Current
Opportunities; $254.55 Administrative General. How about it.
Bob; do your records agree?)
As to my returning dates* My sailing was slightly
delayed by some Holland-Amerlean Line changes, so we now are
scheduled to leave Southampton September 11, reach New York
September 19, and be back at the office around September 22.
But I am requesting an earlier boat should there be any
cancellations, and am still hopeful.
Meanwhile, send me any dope you get on BFA, Bayreuth and
Salzburg. While there, 1*11 negotiate as best I can with both.
BPids
